009package Ch08_BinaryRegions;
010
011
012import java.util.List;
013
014import ij.IJ;
015import ij.ImagePlus;
016import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
017import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
018import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
019import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
020import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.NeighborhoodType2D;
021import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
022import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegion;
023import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.BinaryRegionSegmentation;
024import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.BreadthFirstSegmentation;
025import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.DepthFirstSegmentation;
026import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.RecursiveSegmentation;
027import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.RegionContourSegmentation;
028import imagingbook.common.regions.segment.SequentialSegmentation;
029import imagingbook.common.regions.utils.Display;
030
031/**
032 * <p>
033 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the use of the region
034 * labeling classes in the imagingbook's "regions" package:
035 * </p>
036 * <ul>
037 * <li>{@link BreadthFirstSegmentation},</li>
038 * <li>{@link DepthFirstSegmentation},</li>
039 * <li>{@link RecursiveSegmentation},</li>
040 * <li>{@link RegionContourSegmentation},</li>
041 * <li>{@link SequentialSegmentation}.</li>
042 * </ul>
043 * One of four labeling types can be selected (see the {@link #run(ImageProcessor)} method).
044 * All should produce the same results (except {@link RegionContourSegmentation},
045 * which may run out of memory easily).
046 * Requires a binary (segmented) image.
047 * 
048 * @author WB
049 * @version 2020/12/20
050 * 
051 */
052public class Region_Segmentation_Demo implements PlugInFilter {
053        
054        private enum LabelingMethod {
055                BreadthFirst, 
056                DepthFirst, 
057                Sequential,
058                RegionAndContours,
059                Recursive
060        }
061
062        static LabelingMethod Method = LabelingMethod.BreadthFirst;
063        static NeighborhoodType2D Neighborhood = NeighborhoodType2D.N8;
064        
065        static boolean ColorRegions = false;
066        static boolean ListRegions = false;
067        
068    public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
069                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES;
070    }
071        
072    public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
073        
074                if (!IjUtils.isBinary(ip)) {
075                        IJ.showMessage("Plugin requires a binary image!");
076                        return;
077                }
078                
079        if (!getUserInput())
080                return;
081        
082        if (Method == LabelingMethod.Recursive && 
083                        !IJ.showMessageWithCancel("Recursive labeling", "This may run out of stack memory!\n" + "Continue?")) {
084                        return;
085        }
086        
087        // Copy the original to a new byte image:
088        ByteProcessor bp = ip.convertToByteProcessor(false);
089        
090        
091                BinaryRegionSegmentation segmenter = null;
092                switch(Method) {
093                case BreadthFirst :     
094                        segmenter = new BreadthFirstSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
095                case DepthFirst :               
096                        segmenter = new DepthFirstSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
097                case Sequential :               
098                        segmenter = new SequentialSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
099                case RegionAndContours : 
100                        segmenter = new RegionContourSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
101                case Recursive : 
102                        segmenter = new RecursiveSegmentation(bp, Neighborhood); break;
103                }
104
105                // Retrieve the list of detected regions:
106                List<BinaryRegion> regions = segmenter.getRegions(true);        // regions are sorted by size
107                
108                if (regions == null || regions.isEmpty()) {
109                        IJ.showMessage("No regions detected!");
110                        return;
111                }
112                
113                if (ListRegions) {
114                        IJ.log("Regions sorted by size: " + regions.size());
115                        for (BinaryRegion r: regions) {
116                                IJ.log(r.toString());
117                        }
118                }
119                
120                // Show the resulting labeling as a random color image
121                ImageProcessor labelIp = Display.makeLabelImage(segmenter, ColorRegions);
122                (new ImagePlus(Method.name(), labelIp)).show();
123                
124                // Example for processing all regions:
125//              for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
126//                      double mu11 = mu_11(r); // example for calculating region statistics (see below)
127//                      IJ.log("Region " + r.getLabel() + ": mu11=" + mu11);
128//              }
129    }
130    
131//      /**
132//       * This method demonstrates how a particular region's central moment
133//     * mu_11 could be calculated from the finished region labeling.
134//       * @param r a binary region
135//       * @return
136//       */
137//    private double mu_11 (BinaryRegion r) {
138//      Point ctr = r.getCenterPoint();
139//      final double xc = ctr.getX();   // centroid of this region
140//      final double yc = ctr.getY();
141//      double mu11 = 0;
142//      // iterate through all pixels of regions r:
143//      for (Point p : r) {
144//              mu11 = mu11 + (p.getX() - xc) * (p.getY() - yc);
145//      }
146//      return mu11;
147//    }
148    
149    private boolean getUserInput() {
150                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(Region_Segmentation_Demo.class.getSimpleName());
151                gd.addEnumChoice("Segmentation method", Method);
152                gd.addEnumChoice("Neighborhood type", Neighborhood);
153                gd.addCheckbox("Color result", ColorRegions);
154                gd.addCheckbox("List regions", ListRegions);
155                gd.showDialog();
156                if (gd.wasCanceled()) {
157                        return false;
158                }
159                Method = gd.getNextEnumChoice(LabelingMethod.class);
160                Neighborhood = gd.getNextEnumChoice(NeighborhoodType2D.class);
161                ColorRegions = gd.getNextBoolean();
162                ListRegions = gd.getNextBoolean();
163                return true;
164        }
165    
166    
167}
168
